translation: Dhāraṇī of the Thousand Turns of Great Luminosity

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝散大夫試鴻臚少卿
translation: Tripiṭaka of the Western Translation of the Sutra of the Buddha, Tathāgata, and Young Secretary of the Court

source_sentence: 傳法大師臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial decree by the Minister of the Transmission of the Dharma, Shihu
Thus I've heard.

source_sentence: 一時世尊在忉利天中波利質多羅樹下。
translation: One time, the Bhagavān was under the Śāriputra tree in the Heaven of Thirty-three.
At the time, Indra the god lord was there.
He and all the armies of gods and humans.
They came to the Buddha surrounded by them, front and back.
They each sincerely put their palms together and revered him.
They looked up to the Tathāgata and stayed in order.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主前白佛言。
translation: It was then that the Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊我有陀羅尼名千轉大明。
translation: "Bhagavān, I have a dhāraṇī called Thousand Turns of Great Luminosity.
This dhāraṇī is of great benefit to the world.
It's a great benefit.

source_sentence: 所有一切天龍夜叉餓鬼鳩槃茶等乃至人非人等。
translation: It's for the benefit of all gods, dragons, nightjars, hungry ghosts, kumbhâṇḍas, humans, and nonhumans.
Those who hear this dhāraṇī will be subdued by all sentient beings.
They'll all subdue all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 所有一切不饒益事悉皆除殄。
translation: All the things that are not beneficial are completely eliminated.

source_sentence: 惟願世尊大慈大悲許我宣說。
translation: May the Bhagavān have great kindness and compassion and allow me to preach it.
The Buddha said, "Good, good, Lord of the gods!

source_sentence: 如汝所說彼大千轉大明陀羅尼。
translation: As you've said, this is the great thousand-turning, great-illuminating dhāraṇī.
It's capable of doing great good in the world.
Those of you who want to teach it will do as you wish.
It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra addressed the dhāraṇī of a thousand turns of great insight.

source_sentence: 即說千轉大明陀羅尼曰。
translation: He then spoke the thousand-turn dhāraṇī of great insight, saying.

source_sentence: 怛儞也(二合)他(引一)曩呬怛寫婆帝(引二)婆誐嚩覩(引三)三野體難野過覩(引四)一切部多聞此所說。
translation: "Tathāgata(s)(citation needed)(1) frets and severs(citation needed) (2) bhagavat (citation needed) (3) sanyāti-nirgrantha(s)(citation needed) (4) All the tribes hear what's taught here.
They're terrified, confused, and have their delusions dispersed.

source_sentence: 寶賢夜叉主及輪成就等現眾色像。
translation: The jeweled lord of the yakṣas and the wheel-turning accomplished ones present images in various forms.

source_sentence: 使諸部多諸鬼神等及彼遊方空行起屍瘧病諸惡鬼等。
translation: They cause many of those tribes, demons, spirits, and others to wander aimlessly through space, raising corpses and malaria, and other evil spirits.

source_sentence: 乃至一切行毒根本邪法。
translation: ...and even all those who practice poisonous, fundamental mistaken dharmas.
They do things that harm sentient beings and don't bring benefit.
They'll all be liberated.

source_sentence: 阿曩(引)鉢帝(引一)烏播曩(引)鉢帝(引二)盎誐商迦哩(引三)儗哩(二合)恨拏(二合)哩(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引四)曩謨(引)沒馱(引)野曩謨(引)達哩摩(二合引)野曩謨(引)僧伽(引)野(五)曩謨(引)阿(引)哩野(二合引)嚩路枳帝(引)濕嚩(二合)囉(引)野(六)冐地(引)薩埵(引)野(七)摩賀(引)薩埵(引)野(八)摩賀(引)迦(引)嚕尼迦(引)野(九)曩謨(引)阿(引)哩野(二合)摩賀(引)薩瑳(二合引)摩波囉(二合引)鉢多(二合引)野(十)怛儞也(二合)他(引十一)目訖帝(二合引)尾目訖帝(二合引十二)鼻(引)那儞(引)尾鼻(引)那儞(引十三)儞哩摩(二合)隸(引十四)尾摩隸(引十五)穌目契(引)尾目契(引十六)瞢誐隸(引)穌瞢誐隷(十七)一切王怖解脫。
translation: Anon(citation needed) Pati(citation needed) 1. Upanao(citation needed) Pati(citation needed) 2. Aṅga Shangari(citation needed) 3. Suspicious Li(b) Hanna(b) Li(citation needed) Saha(b) He(citation needed) 4. Anonamu(citation needed) Buddhadhara(citation needed) 5. Anonamu(citation needed) A(citation needed) Lirino(b) Mohe(citation needed) Luqidi(citation needed) Mohe(citation needed) Mabhor(citation needed) Sattva(citation needed) 8. Mohe(citation needed) Ka(citation needed) Nirunika(citation needed) 9.
He's liberated from the fear of all the stars and planets that change into monsters.

source_sentence: 一切自他軍眾鬪戰怖解脫。
translation: He's liberated from the fear of all the fights between his own army and the fighters of others.
He's liberated from the fear of all armies and battles.
He's liberated from the fear of all floods and fires that burn.
He's afraid and liberated from all severe illness and suffering.
He's afraid of and liberated from all poisonous and harmful harm.
He's afraid of lions and elephants, afraid of beasts, and afraid of tigers.
The bear fears the tiger's fears ...
fear of all unwholesome animals ...

source_sentence: 大海漂溺怖深山閴寂怖。
translation: fear of drowning in the ocean ... fear of the depths and the silence of the mountains ...
... even the fear of difficult water beaches.
All these fears are liberated.

source_sentence: 曩謨娑(引)訖哩(二合引一)商迦致(引)商迦致(引二)迦嚕(引)致(引)迦嚕致(引)儞曳(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引三)入王宮時見大臣。
translation: (1) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (2) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (3) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (4) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (5) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (6) Ṛṣamuṣya (cited); (7) Ṛṣya (cited); (8) Ṛṣya (cited); (9) Ṛṣya (cited); (10) Ṛṣya (cited); (11) Ṛṣya (cited)
When he's traveling in battle, he sometimes meets an enemy.
They sometimes see poisonous snakes and vipers and dragons.

source_sentence: 時遇夜叉毘舍遮羅剎烏鉢娑摩(二合引)囉所魅時。
translation: When they encounter the night flying yakṣas and piśācīras, they'll see a man who's haunted by a snake or a dragon.
It doesn't stop there when he's in a mountain or ocean peril.
All such fears and intimidations are liberated.

source_sentence: 曩謨(引)怛囉(二合引)赧婆嚩室羅(二合引)野赧(一)呬隷呬隷(二)唧隷唧隷(三)迦(引)播隷(四)摩(引)鄧霓娑嚩(二合引)賀(引五)又復王法所執或被枷鎖杻械牢固其身。
translation: In addition, the king's laws may hold them, or they may be chained or restrained by chains and armor that secure their bodies.

source_sentence: 一切枉橫憂苦逼切悉皆解脫。
translation: They are freed from all the wrongful, harsh, and painful oppressions.

source_sentence: 曩謨(引)多(引)哩(引)多(引)哩(引一)烏哆(引)哩(引二)覩哩(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引三)又復星曜所持。
translation: Nāgârjuna (cited), Tuṣita (cited), and Śāri (cited) are also supported by stars and celestial bodies.

source_sentence: 或惡夢變怪致諸病苦夭枉至死。
translation: Sometimes a bad dream or a strange transformation causes illness, pain, death, and premature death.

source_sentence: 乃至鬪諍論理互相恐逼。
translation: They may even be oppressed by arguments and theories.
All of these fears are liberated.

source_sentence: 曩謨(引)左囉左囉(一)娑囉娑囉(二)尾娑囉尾娑囉(三)沒馱野(二合)沒馱野(二合四)冐(引)馱(引)野彌底娑嚩(二合引)賀(五)洛乞叉(二合)洛乞叉(二合)[牟*含](六)薩哩嚩(二合)薩怛嚩(二合引)喃(引)左娑嚩(二合引)賀(引七)阿(引)哩野(二合)室哩(二合)滿哩馱(二合)覽(八)布瑟致(二合)俱嚕娑嚩(二合引)賀(引)摩麼(引)布哩嚩(二合)羅滿哩馱(二合)喃(十)扇(引)底孕(二合)俱囉娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十一)曩謨(引)賀帝(引)儞賀帝(引十二)薩哩嚩(二合)努瑟幀(二合引)鉢囉(二合)底孕(二合)惹儞(十三)謨(引)賀儞謨(引)乞叉(二合)尼娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十四)曩謨(引)迦致(引)儞致迦吒致(引)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十五)曩謨(引)阿(引)囉尼嚩(引)囉尼(十六)薩哩嚩(二合)儞哩嚩(二合引)囉尼娑嚩(二合引)賀(引十七)又復一切惡人行不善事。
translation: In the past, Mo(citation needed) Zorazhara(a) Sārāsara(b) Vaiśravaṇa(c) Mudrā(citation needed) Mudrā(citation needed) Mudrā(citation needed) Mudrā(citation needed) Mudrā(citation needed) Mudrā(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) Sādhara(citation needed) 7.
They hold wrong spells and perform various prayers.
That will cause sentient beings to be deluded and crazy.
All such things will be liberated.

source_sentence: 嚕嚕計(一)哩嚕計(二)底瑟姹(二合)滿馱夜(引)弭(三)夜嚩誐嚩(二合)切(四)尾夢贊底(五)呬隷唧隷(六)迦(引)播(引)隸(七)迦瑟站(二合引)誐薩哩嚩(二合)哆(八)薩哩嚩(二合)婆曳毘藥(二合)娑嚩(二合引)賀(引九)世尊我此千轉大明。
translation: Rulukti(1) Rirulukti(2) Tejaprabhā (2) Pūrṇa(2) (3) Yajurveda(2) (4) Maitreya(2) (5) Freyaketu(6) Kāśyapa(6) Lumbinī(7) Kāśyapa(2) (7) Garuḍa(2) (8) Sarīḍa(2) (2) Vāma(2) (2) Saṃsāra(2) (9) Bhagavān, this is my thousand turns of great knowledge.
It's like the wheel-turning sage king.
He has a maṇi-jewel named Tathāgata.
Whatever desires come naturally, they'll manifest themselves.

source_sentence: 我此千轉大明亦復如是。
translation: This thousand turns of mine is likewise great luminosity.

source_sentence: 若有得者凡諸苦惱悉皆解脫。
translation: If anyone attains it, they'll be liberated from all suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 世尊末世之時眾生薄福。
translation: At the time of the Bhagavān's final age, sentient beings were weak in merit.
They didn't know the refuge of the honored Three Treasures.
They abandoned their bodies, mouths, and minds, and always did evil.

source_sentence: 是故世間諸惡鬼神伺得其便。
translation: As a result, the world's evil spirits and demons find it easy to get hold of them.
They conceal their own form and substance and pretend to manifest it.
During the day and night, they disturb sentient beings.
They cause all sentient beings to experience various kinds of suffering and distress.
Bhagavān, if sentient beings were to encounter this kind of evil spirit, they'd be afflicted in various ways, suffering, and distress.

source_sentence: 遇斯惡鬼種種惱亂苦惱之時。
translation: When they encounter these evil spirits, they're afflicted and distressed in various ways.

source_sentence: 乃至世間一切不可意時。
translation: It doesn't even matter what the world thinks.

source_sentence: 當於清淨之地取土七把。
translation: They must take seven handfuls of dirt from a pure place.

source_sentence: 每一把讀誦此大明加持七遍。
translation: Recite this great teaching seven times with each handful, and then apply it.
Mix it together into seven balls and tie them to the lappet of your robe.

source_sentence: 當令一切行不饒益惡鬼神等。
translation: That will cause all practitioners of unwholesome behavior to abstain from benefiting bad spirits and other spirits.
They won't dare to approach them, and they'll retreat in fear.
It will make that person peaceful day and night.
All unwholesomeness will be extinguished.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主說此千轉大明陀羅尼已。
translation: It was then that the lord Indra explained this dhāraṇī of a thousand turns of great insight.

source_sentence: 踊躍歡喜與諸天眾禮佛而退。
translation: He rejoiced and jumped for joy as he and the gods paid homage to the Buddha and withdrew.
Dhāraṇī of the Thousand Turns of Great Luminosity
